did.abstract: Typewritten manuscript on the history of the Greenleaf Female Institute, located in Brooklyn, New York. The manuscript was written by Sarah Ball, a former student of the school, circa 1916. Also included are two poems written by Ball about the school.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Greenleaf Female Institute was founded by Alfred Greenleaf and was loacted at 106 Pierrepont St in the Brooklyn Heights neighborhood of Brooklyn, New York. It was a well-known girls' school that catered to wealthy Brooklyn families.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Typewritten manuscript on the history of the Greenleaf Female Institute, located in Brooklyn, New York. The manuscript was written by Sarah Ball, a former student of the school, circa 1916. Also included are two poems written by Ball about the school.
